p: We have developed a novel sialidase substrate, BTP3-Neu5Ac, that enables an easy and rapid assay for sialidase detection [ 35]. By sialidase reaction, water-soluble BTP3-Neu5Ac produces BTP3, which is a crystalline, water-insoluble, acid-resistant, and fluorescently stable compound (Ex/Em = 372 nm/526 nm). Although BTP3-Neu5Ac itself is not fluorescent, BTP3 is readily deposited in a location of sialidase activity, enabling fluorescent imaging of dot-blotted virus and virus-infected cells. BTP3-Neu5Ac can visualize sialidase activity blotted on filter papers or polyvinylidene difluoride (PVDF) membranes since water-insoluble BTP3 is easily concentrated on the membranes after sialidase reaction [ 35, 36]. BTP3-Neu5Ac is applicable to sialidase-carrying viruses such as IAV, IBV, Newcastle disease virus, Sendai virus, human parainfluenza virus, and mumps virus [ 36â€“ 40].
